author: @englishjagrannews
title: 'BJP Is Anti-Hindu, They Are Trying To Mislead': Karnataka Ministers Defend 10 Per Cent Tax On Temples
text: - By ANI - Published: Fri, 23 Feb 2024 12:06 PM (IST) - Source:ANI After criticisms regarding the Karnataka government's amendments to the Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowment Bill, ministers Ramalinga Reddy and Dinesh Gundu Rao came in defence of the decision while criticising the opposition, BJP. Minister for Transport, Ramalinga Reddy alleged that BJP is 'anti-Hindu' adding that the party which was in power in 2011 had made the amendments to the Bill. "We are not anti-Hindu. Actually, the BJP is anti-Hindu. This Act came into existence in 2003. In 2011, they made some amendments. At that time, up to Rs 5 lakh, there were about 34,000 temples - they did not give any money for Dharmika Parishad. From Rs 5 Lakhs to Rs 10 Lakhs, there are about 193 'B grade' temples - they have to give 5 per cent. More than Rs 10 Lakhs, there are about 205 temples - they have to give 10 per cent. They approved this amendment in 2011 in the Assembly. Who is anti-Hindu? BJP," Minister Reddy said. [Also Read'Won't Have Any Role In Party Leadership': Gajendra Shekhawat On Ashok Gehlot’s Future In Congress](/india/wont-have-any-role-in-party-leadership-gajendra-singh-shekhawat-on-ashok-gehlot-future-in-congress-10135496) "In the interest of the most neglected 'C grade' temples in Karnataka, if I give Rs 2-3 lakhs, they can repair, reconstruct. This is the idea," he said. Minister for Health, Dinesh Gundu Rao said that the BJP should realise the Bill is for the benefit of the temples. He alleged that when the government is trying to help smaller temples, the BJP is trying to mislead. "The BJP should realise that what we are doing is actually for the benefit of temples. We amended the Act. Temples which were earning more than Rs 25 lakhs were being charged 10 per cent earlier. Even when the BJP government was there, the same 10 per cent was being taken by the Muzrai Department. Now, we have actually taken up the slab and gone to Rs 1 crore and above. We are, in fact, helping the smaller temples," Minister Rao said. "BJP is trying to mislead the people. This money is going to be used for smaller temples so that we can develop those temples," he added. [Also ReadEx-Maharashtra CM Manohar Joshi Dies At 86; PM Modi Says, 'He Worked Tirelessly For State’s Progress'](/india/manohar-joshi-death-news-former-maharashtra-chief-minister-and-former-lok-sabha-speaker-passes-away-at86-10135444) Karnataka government passed 'Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Bill 2024' that mandates the state to collect 10 per cent tax from temples that have revenues exceeding Rs 1 crore and 5 per cent from those with revenues ranging between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 1 crore. The BJP criticized the state government, accusing it of implementing 'Anti-Hindu' policies. State President Vijayendra Yediyurappa alleged that the government passed the bill to replenish its depleted coffers. "The Congress government, which is adopting consistently anti-Hindu policies in the state, has now taken a crooked look at the revenue of Hindu temples and passed the Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments bill to fill its empty coffers," he said on X. Former CM and BJP veteran Yediyurappa questioned why only Hindu temples are being scrutinized and not the incomes of other religions. Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said that the allegations regarding the amendments to the Bill "appear to be misrepresented", "aiming only at misleading the public" and "polarizing people along communal lines for political leverage." He alleged that the BJP leaders want the youth of the country to abandon their jobs and fight an imaginary war, solely to benefit the BJP politically. (Note: Except for the headline, this ANI copy has not been edited by Jagran English staff) [English Jagran.com](https://english.jagran.com/)Jagran English is available on WhatsApp. Join now for latest news from India and around the world. [Join our WhatsApp Channel](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029VaAYubwADTOESVWMhl0l?utm_source=website&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=whatsappchannel)

author: 网易
title: 网传扁担女孩高考527分，班主任辟谣：不实，不要再打扰她|刘燕|好成绩|高考成绩|高考分数_网易订阅
text:
广西灌阳县女孩刘燕因高考完用扁担挑行李出圈。高考已能查分，6月26日早上，有自媒体发布女孩高考成绩527分的消息。
6月26日，刘燕班主任陈老师向记者表示：这个肯定是谣言，不实的！分数是她自行查询，没对外公布。当地宣传部门也回应紫牛新闻记者，刘燕十分低调，她的分数没对外公布，当地都没有消息，也不愿再打扰她。当地教育部门表示，会尊重女孩个人意愿，不对外公布分数。
多说一句：不管考得不好，她已经赢得人生大考
虽然大家并不知道扁担女孩刘燕的高考分数，但记者发现，评论区已有很多网友留言：“挺好的！不过多打扰，尊重女孩隐私，也祝福女孩前程似锦！”高考落下帷幕，很多感人的瞬间留在人心。扁担女孩挑行李这一简单小事，受到广大网友关注，最主要的还是赞赏她身抗扁担、笃定前行的那份精神气。那是当代青年十分需要的独立自主的精神风貌。在分数论的焦虑里，比成绩更重要的，是孩子能够离开父母的保护、无畏风雨、不惧前行的能力和勇气。正如一位网友说的：“不管考得好不好，扁担女孩已经赢得了人生的大考！”相信这样的姑娘，无论以后去哪里上学，父母都是放心的，相信她也能好好照顾自己，走出一条属于自己的路。我们和广大网友一样，对扁担女孩不再过多打扰，祝愿女孩未来一帆风顺！
（来源：扬子晚报）

author: France 2
title: Colère des agriculteurs : des mesures en faveur de l'environnement décriées par le secteur
text:
Utiliser de moins en moins de pesticides, devoir économiser la ressource en eau, ou encore payer plus de taxes sur le gazole non-routier qui alimente les engins agricoles : autant de mesures en faveur de l'environnement qui sont au cœur de la contestation des agriculteurs. Dans les Yvelines, l'agriculteur Olivier Coupery n'en fait pas un tabou : les pesticides font partie de son quotidien. Des produits chimiques indispensables, selon lui, mais polluants et destructeurs pour la biodiversité. Alors, l'Europe veut diviser par deux leur usage d'ici à 2030. Un objectif impossible à tenir pour le cultivateur.
Le secteur victime du réchauffement climatique Dans la Vienne, l'eau est un autre sujet de discorde. Pour remplir sa bassine, l'agriculteur Luc Métais pompe dans la nappe phréatique jusqu'à 240 000 mètres cube. Les militants écologistes l'accusent de s'accaparer une ressource de plus en plus rare, mais pour le céréalier, sans cette réserve, son exploitation pourrait disparaître. Pour tous ces agriculteurs, préserver l'environnement est une source de contraintes. Un paradoxe, alors que le secteur est aussi l'une des premières victimes des conséquences du réchauffement climatique. Aujourd'hui, l'agriculture française est responsable de 19% des émissions de gaz à effet de serre du pays.

author: Agencia EFE
title: Cinco regiones espa\u00f1olas en alerta por las lluvias, Andaluc\u00eda en riesgo extremo
text: Cinco regiones españolas siguen este viernes en alerta ante las fuertes precipitaciones y las tormentas que se van a registrar durante el día, y en el caso de Andalucía (sur) el nivel es "rojo" (riesgo extremo), a causa de las intensas lluvias que se van a producir en la provincia de Huelva, que en algunos casos pueden llegar a acumular hasta 140 litros por metro cuadrado. Una depresión aislada en niveles altos (Dana o gota fría) ha golpeado con fuerza varias regiones, en especial la Comunidad Valenciana. (Le puede interesar: Las cinco claves para entender la investigación que abrió la Unión Europea contra Temu: ¿por qué lo señalan de posible venta de productos ilegales?). El número provisional de fallecidos por las inundaciones en España asciende a 158, de los cuales 155 murieron en la provincia de Valencia, otros 2 en la de Castilla-La Mancha y 1 más en Andalucía, pero sigue habiendo una cifra indeterminada de desaparecidos y la emergencia continúa. Además, se han producido importantes daños en infraestructuras y cortes en agua, electricidad y cobertura telefónica, con miles de personas desplazadas de sus viviendas o, en otros casos, recluidas en ellas ante la imposibilidad de salir. Para este 1 de noviembre está además en alerta "naranja" (riesgo importante) la Comunidad Valenciana (este), que ha padecido durante los últimos días los efectos más devastadores de la dana y las lluvias van a continuar a lo largo del día de hoy, según los datos de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología. El mapa de alertas "naranja" se completa con avisos en grandes áreas de Andalucía, de las comunidades de Islas Baleares y Cataluña, y la Aemet ha advertido de que en muchos lugares de estas comunidades las precipitaciones van a volver a superar hoy los 100 litros por metro cuadrado. (Además: La dana en España: aumenta a 155 el número de muertos, mientras siguen las labores de remoción de escombros y rescate). Está además en alerta "amarilla" (riesgo) la comunidad de Extremadura (oeste). Los avisos más importantes, el nivel "rojo" (riesgo extremo) se concentran en el litoral de Huelva y en Andévalo y Condado, en la provincia de Huelva, donde las previsiones apuntan que se acumularán hasta 140 litros por metro cuadrado durante las primeras horas de la mañana, aunque las lluvias continuarán siendo intensas y persistentes a lo largo del día. Además de los avisos, la Aemet ha publicado un mensaje en la red social X en el que advierte que la situación adversa va a continuar durante todo el fin de semana y de la importancia de consultar el estado de las carreteras antes de viajar y seguir las recomendaciones de Protección Civil. "Vamos a lanzar un mensaje muy claro y lo vamos a dejar fijado. La emergencia meteorológica no ha finalizado. La dana sigue sobre España", ha publicado la Aemet\/Comunidad Valenciana, y ha dejado fijado este mensaje en su cuenta de X. EFE

author: Grace Bellinghausen, The Times
title: Sarpy's weekend events: From blizzard bliss to Cajun dish
text:
Bundle up for a weekend of warmth and excitement in Sarpy County as a range of events unfold! Dive into the winter wonderland of the Shadow Lake Blizzard Bash, where live music, ice carving, and charming winter characters steal the spotlight. Embrace the festivities at Lucky Bucket Brewing's Mardi Gras celebration, where king cake brown ale is on tap and spicy Cajun delights await.
Saturday, Jan. 20
Shadow Lake Blizzard Bash
Cozy up in the warmth of heated tents, enjoy live music by Highway 6 from 4-8 p.m., encounter delightful winter characters for the kids from 2-4 p.m., indulge in a variety of food and adult beverages, and don't miss the highlight of the day – continuous live ice carving throughout the free event!
Shadow Lake Towne Center, 72nd Street & Hwy 370 Papillion
2 to 8 p.m.
Lucky Bucket's Mardi Gras
Enjoy king cake brown ale, devour Cajun food and dance to performances by the Gator Boys for a celebration of Mardi Gras at Lucky Bucket Brewing. Wear your beads and don't forget to
RSVP, the party is free.
11941 Centennial Road La Vista
11 a.m. to 11 p.m.
10748 Bash Sponsored by Bon Vivant Suites & Coffee Society Cafe
Celebrate the first anniversary of Coffee Society Cafe and the grand opening of Bon Vivant Suites with a lively free event featuring a diverse pop-up shop market. Enjoy shopping from various vendors, savor special menus at Coffee Society Cafe, take tours of the newly opened Bon Vivant Suites, and anticipate exciting giveaways throughout the weekend. Pop-up vendors include Graythelabel, Frankie Dee, Kindling Co Flower Truck and
more.
10748 Virginia Plaza, La Vista
Saturday and Sunday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Women's Self-Defense Workshop
Take advantage of a free women's self defense workshop to learn and brush up on self defense skills to keep your safety a priority this year.
Agoge Martial Arts, 1258 Royal Drive, Papillion
1 to 3 p.m.
Kids' DIY-U Workshop: My First DIY Toolbox
Put your kid to work and head to Home Depot for a Kids toolbox workshop. The class is lead by Home Depot Red Vest experts and will help your little-DIYers explore the fundamentals of tools and hardware.
Home Depot, 8707 South 71st Plaza, Papillion
10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Sunday, Jan. 21
Czech Feast 2024
Czech out Lucky Bucket Brewing Company this Sunday for famous homemade Czech food with authentic recipes from the Bohemian Cafe at the taproom and jamming out with Barry Boyce.
Lucky Bucket Brewing Company, 11941 Centennial Road, La Vista
2 to 6 p.m.
Nebraska Reptile Show
Lizard lovers, snake enthusiasts and scaled creature connoisseurs unite for a one day reptile convention. This event offers a chance to engage directly with local reptile businesses. Discover thousands of reptiles, amphibians, feeders, invertebrates, and various supplies. It's a family-friendly affair, so bring your kids and explore the show. Don't miss the extensive array of supplies, from cages and tanks to bedding, toys, and decorative items. Tickets are available at the door.
Beardmore Event Center, 3730 Raynor Pkwy., Bellevue
10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

author: @smaucionewypr
title: CDC warns about spike in Parvovirus cases in Maryland | WYPR
text: CDC warns about spike in Parvovirus cases in Maryland The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is warning about a surge in Parvovirus throughout the nation. The disease can be particularly dangerous for pregnant people, people with Sickle Cell Disease and those who are immunocompromised. “Parvovirus is fairly contagious, and it's presented via respiratory droplets,” said Dr. Amesh Adalja, a senior scholar at the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security. “This is something where you would want to wear a mask if you knew somebody had parvovirus, and you're in one of those high-risk groups.” Parvovirus is nothing new, it’s commonly called the fifth disease because of its historical classification in common illnesses in children. Symptoms include joint pain, fever, sore throat and a rash on the cheeks. The disease is sometimes called “slapped cheek” disease because of the rash. The only treatment for the disease is to manage its symptoms. The CDC says to keep children who are experiencing symptoms out of daycare or school. The disease is no longer contagious after the rash subsides. The surge comes as the nation is also going through an [uptick](https://www.wypr.org/wypr-news/2024-08-13/maryland-seeing-very-high-covid-levels-in-wastewater-virus-activity) in COVID-19 cases.

organizations.name: centers for disease control and prevention
johns hopkins center for health security
